title: Executive Order 8698-Exemption of Harry L. Mickey From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that Harry L. Mickey, messenger, The White House Office, Executive Office of the President, who, during the month of April, 1941, will reach the retirement age prescribed for automatic separation from the service, applicable to him, be exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), 1 hereby exempt the said Harry L Mickey from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending April 30, 1942.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8698-Exemption of Harry L. Mickey From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/368292
